title: 204: Frederick Douglass on the 5th of July
dc:creator: A.J. Hanenburg
description: In this episode, Thomas walks us through the context and performance of Frederick Douglass's speech given to the ladies of the "Rochester Anti-Slavery Sewing Society" in Corinthian Hall on July 5th. The speech does not suck.
itunes:author: Three guys who love fireworks
itunes:subtitle: Frederick Douglass, Master of Tone
itunes:summary: In this episode, Thomas walks us through the context and performance of Frederick Douglass's speech given to the ladies of the "Rochester Anti-Slavery Sewing Society" in Corinthian Hall on July 5th. The speech does not suck.
